intro: Lasiacis grisebachii var. lindelieana, commonly known as the Lindelieana variety of the genus Lasiacis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes shrubs and herbs found in tropical and subtropical regions. This variety is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four to five petals, and are clustered in small inflorescences. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
